DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether an omega-3 fatty acid supplementation is effective in the prevention of progressive cognitive decline in elderly people aged 75 years or older.
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Supplement for the Prevention of Cognitive Decline in a Very Elderly Population.
DOC.detailed_description: Participants are residents at three nursing homes in Pamplona (Spain). We assumed that 20% of elderly people have a cognitive decline and we estimated a 5% of cognitive decline in the intervention group. Sample size estimated was 85 participants for each arm, assuming two groups with an alpha of 0.05, 80% power and accounting for 10% of participants lost to follow-up. Repeated measures ANOVA, Cox regression and multiple linear regression analysis will be used for the statistical analysis of data.
DOC.criteria: Elderly people aged 75 years or older Global Deterioration Scale < 4 Capacity to complete the tests Neurological, physical or psychiatry conditions, obtained from the medical history, that may have an influence on the cognitive function. Dementia History of epilepsy, convulsions
